Jeremiah states simply that he prayed after handing over the deed. No figurative language; the verbs used are straightforward.

This verse is rich in classic biblical figures: (1) 'heaven and earth' as a merism for all creation; (2) 'outstretched arm' as an anthropomorphic metaphor for divine power; (3) the statement that nothing is 'too wondrous' (too difficult) for God as a hyperbolic universal negative.
